repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: This manuscript, without title, contains the incomplete conjugation paradigm of 125 Tamil verbs. For each Tamil verb, only the first singular person in the present, in the past, and in the future tense is given, along with two other Tamil forms.
The listed verb forms are represented by simple or compound verbs, as well as by verb phrases.
For each Tamil verb form there is also a French gloss consisting in the translation of the whole verb paradigm in the present, past, and future tense.
The Tamil present and future tense is translated with a French verb in the present and future tense respectively, while the Tamil past tense is translated with a French perfect past.

support.p: Recurrent watermark AL found at folios 5r, 7r, 13r, 17r, 19r, 25r, 31r, 37r, 39r, 43r (cf. n. 100 in Laurentius and Laurentius 2018: 67).

extent.measure: 1 + 48 + 1 + 1 (u1a + U1 + U2 +u1b). 1 front guard leaf + 48 + 1 + 1 back guard leaf.

supportDesc.foliation: There are two foliations: an original one and an added one. The added one runs from 1 to 48 and it is placed on the top right side of each recto. The second one appears both on the recto and verso of each folio, hence on the upper right and left side. It reveals that the manuscript is incomplete and that the original order was different. For example: at f. 2r the original foliation corresponds to f. 9r; at f. 6r it corresponds to 17r; at f. 9v at f. 25r.

supportDesc.condition: Very good state of preservation, in spite of wet stains on the manuscript.

layoutDesc.layout: Each page contains two columns. Even though it seems that the manuscript was intended for personal use, it is ordered. On the left column there is the Tamil verb form, on the right column the French gloss. The page is not marked by lines and layout margins. The columns runs approx. for 70 mm (width) and 160/170mm height. There is a margin on the left side of each page: 10 mm for verso folios, and 15 mm for recto folios. Upper layout: 10 mm, bottom layout: 35mm. If there is the paradigm of one single verb there are 20 lines per page (20 folios), otherwise the number increase to 28 (or different) if there is the paradigm of more verbs.

handNote.desc: It is possible to identify two hands: the first one copied/wrote the whole manuscript. The second hand inserted additions and made corrections. There is not differentiation between long and short e/o, and between ra and long a.

The final note glued on the back guard leaf seems to be written by a third hand. The handwriting of the Tamil language in this note is similar to the one of the folios of trying of Tamil script between the Portugese manuscript and the first section of Indien 188. This handwriting is also similar to the one used in the first table in NAF 8878. It could be the hand of Abraham-Hyacinthe Anquetil-Duperron (1731-1805).

additions.desc: BnF Shelfmark sticker INDIEN 502 (front cover, recto)
BnF Shelfmark in black pencil Tamoul N° 502 and BnF Shelfmark in black ink N° 502 (f[1]r).

stamp (diametre = 280 mm): red circle containing 3 fleur-de-lis summounted by a crown with the inscription BIBLIOTHEQUE ROYALE (f. 1r and f. 48v. Dates to the Restauration period. It suggests that the manuscript was stamped between July 1830 and January 1831. See n. 20 in Josserand and Bruno (1960: 281).

binding.p: Hard paper cover, marbled on the outside.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Not after 1831 because of stamps.

provenance.p: Provenance unknown in Cabaton’s catalogue (1912), but possibly a manuscript from Anquetil Duperron's collection.

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Conservative. Hence, puḷḷi, ō, and ē are used only if they are found in the manuscript. ― Abbreviations ― cf. = compare, f. = folio, ff. = folios, r. = recto, U/u = unit (codicological and/or textual), v. = verso
